title: Question 10
prompt: Which of the following questions is explained by the text?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

Bacteria appear in several different shapes. Many bacteria have flagella, which rotate like screws and help the bacteria move. Flagella may be arranged in different ways on a bacterium. The cell structure shows a bacterium with one flagellum. A bacterium may have several flagella on one end, one flagellum on each end, or flagella distributed around the cell.
feedback:
The question “What is the main function of flagella?” is answered in the text that accompanies the diagram. Flagella help the bacteria move.



Bacteria appear in several different shapes. Many bacteria have flagella, which rotate like screws and help the bacteria move. Flagella may be arranged in different ways on a bacterium. The cell structure shows a bacterium with one flagellum. A bacterium may have several flagella on one end, one flagellum on each end, or flagella distributed around the cell.
